html:
They are gone over the passage. This phrase describes the advance of the Assyrian army as it crosses over an unnamed mountain pass on its way to Jerusalem.

they have taken up their lodging at Geba. The Assyrian army temporarily halts its advance to rest at Geba.

Ramah is afraid/Gibeah…is fled. As the Assyrian army approaches, Jerusalem's fearful inhabitants flee. Gibeah of Saul is so named because it was the place of Saul's birth and his residence while he was king (1 Sam. 10:26; 13-15).
